summary: Website project for JP Digital Marketing Ropar: take the current draft offline (delete/unpublish from the internet) and change the site URL to use the custom domain jpdigitalmarketing.in instead of a Caffeine draft/subdomain.
architectural_notes: User confirmed they want the currently deployed draft pushed live (production publish approved).
User requests taking the currently deployed draft offline (unpublish/delete).
User requests trying a different custom domain: jpdigitalmarketing.in (instead of jpdigitalmarketing.net).
known_issues: Production deploy failed with a deployment error when attempting to take Draft Version 5 live.

existing_features.title: Clarify and provision a second, unique Caffeine subdomain for the new site; do not reuse the exact subdomain `jpdigitalmarketingropar.caffeine.xyz` because two different sites cannot share the same URL.
Apply a creative, coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) across the frontend so the site looks consistent and professional. Use English for all user-facing text.
Implement a permanent (production) publish workflow so a user can publish the deployed site live and see a clear “Published” status afterward.

When the user publishes the site to production, persist the chosen subdomain in the backend and expose it via an API so the frontend can reliably display the live domain (including after a page refresh), instead of depending on in-memory UI state.
Add an unpublish/takedown capability so the currently deployed site can be taken offline (i.e., no longer marked as published) and the UI clearly reflects that it has been unpublished.

Support configuring and displaying the custom domain "jpdigitalmarketing.net" as the primary site URL instead of the Caffeine draft/subdomain URL, including persisting the custom domain in the backend so it survives refreshes.

Update the existing provisioning/publishing UI so it can present both the Caffeine subdomain (for provisioning) and the custom domain (for the final URL), and ensure the status panels and toasts reflect the correct URL after changes.

Update the frontend provisioning/publishing UI to provide a clear “Delete/Reset site configuration” action that calls the backend reset API and explicitly communicates (in English) that the caffeine.xyz *draft* URL is a preview URL and the intended primary URL can be set to the custom domain jpdigitalmarketing.net. After reset, the UI must clear inputs and reflect the offline/unconfigured state.

Make it easy to set the primary URL to the custom domain jpdigitalmarketing.net by pre-filling the custom domain input with "jpdigitalmarketing.net" when no custom domain is configured yet (while still allowing the user to edit it), and ensure all URL/status messaging prefers the configured custom domain over any caffeine.xyz URL.

Update the application’s custom domain target from "jpdigitalmarketing.net" to "jpdigitalmarketing.in" so that when no custom domain is configured yet, the UI pre-fills and recommends "jpdigitalmarketing.in" and all user-facing example text references "jpdigitalmarketing.in" (not .net).

new_feature_requests.summary: Remove/unpublish the currently deployed draft site from the internet (takedown/delete)

Add a backend API to fully delete/reset the current site configuration so the user can effectively “delete the caffeine subdomain website” (take it offline and clear any stored subdomain/custom-domain). The reset must set published=false and clear the stored subdomain and custom domain so subsequent reads return null.
Update custom domain target from jpdigitalmarketing.net to jpdigitalmarketing.in for the website URL (custom domain setup)

projectName: Provision an additional Caffeine site URL for JP Digital Marketing Ropar
